fields.name: date
fields.description: Service date.

fields.name: trip_id_performed
fields.description: Identifies the trip performed.

fields.name: stop_sequence
fields.description: Ordered stop the vehicle is serving on a particular trip.

fields.name: vehicle_id
fields.description: Identifies the vehicle.

fields.name: dwell
fields.description: Indicates the amount of time a vehicle spent stopped at a stop in seconds.

fields.name: stop_id
fields.description: Identifies the stop.

fields.name: checkpoint
fields.description:
Indicates of the stop should be used for evaluating schedule adherence, on-time performance, and other KPIs. This could be populated to match the GTFS “timepoint” field. Valid options are:
0 - Stop is not used in evaluating KPIs.
1 or empty - Stop is used in evaluating KPIs.

fields.name: schedule_arrival_time
fields.description: Scheduled time at which the vehicle arrives at a stop.

fields.name: schedule_departure_time
fields.description: Scheduled time at which the vehicle departs from a stop.

fields.name: actual_arrival_time
fields.description: Time at which the vehicle arrives at a stop.

fields.name: actual_departure_time
fields.description: Time at which the vehicle departs from a stop.

fields.name: distance
fields.description: Observed distance in meters from the previous stop traveled by the vehicle.

fields.name: boarding_1
fields.description: Number of riders that entered the front-most or right-most door of the vehicle

fields.name: alighting_1
fields.description: Number of riders that exited the front-most or right-most door of the vehicle

fields.name: boarding_2
fields.description: Number of riders that entered the rest of the vehicle’s doors.

fields.name: alighting_2
fields.description: Number of riders that exited the rest of the vehicle’s doors.

fields.name: load
fields.description: Number of riders on the vehicle when departing the stop.

fields.name: door_open
fields.description: Time at which the doors opened.

fields.name: door_close
fields.description: Time at which the doors closed.

fields.name: door_status
fields.description:
Indicates actions of the doors during the stop visit. For example:
-Doors did not open
-Front door opened and back doors remain closed
-Back doors opened and front door remained closed
-All doors opened
-Other configuration

fields.name: ramp_deployed_time
fields.description: Duration of time a ramp is deployed, in seconds.

fields.name: ramp_failure
fields.description:
Indicates if the ramp deployment failed at a stop. Valid options are:
 0 - Ramp deployment successful.
 1 - Ramp deployment failed.

fields.name: kneel_deployed_time
fields.description: Duration of time a kneel is deployed in seconds.

fields.name: lift_deployed_time
fields.description: Duration of time in seconds of time a lift is deployed.

fields.name: bike_rack_deployed
fields.description:
Indicates if the bike rack was deployed at a stop. Valid options are:
0 - Bike rack was not deployed.
1 - Bike rack was deployed.

fields.name: bike_load
fields.description: Number of bikes on the vehicle when departing the stop.

fields.name: revenue
fields.description: Amount of revenue collected at the stop.

fields.name: number_of_transactions
fields.description: Number of fare transactions that occurred at a stop.

fields.name: transaction_revenue_x
fields.description:
Indicates the revenue from a specified fare medium. For example, cash revenue would be represented by the field name transaction_revenue_0. Valid values for x are:
0 - Cash or coins.
1 - Smart card or ticket.
2 - Magnetic-stripe card or ticket.
3 - Bank card (credit or debit card).
4 - Mobile NFC (smartphone tap, etc.).
5 - Optical scan (of mobile app screen or paper ticket).
6 - Button pressed by driver or operator to indicate a boarding or alighting passenger.
7 - Other type.

fields.name: transaction_count_x
fields.description:
Number of fare transactions made by a specified fare medium. For example, the count of cash transactions would be represented by the field name transaction_count_0.
Valid values for x are:
0 - Cash or coins.
1 - Smart card or ticket.
2 - Magnetic-stripe card or ticket.
3 - Bank card (credit or debit card).
4 - Mobile NFC (smartphone tap, etc.).
5 - Optical scan (of mobile app screen or paper ticket).
6 - Button pressed by driver or operator to indicate a boarding or alighting passenger.
7 - Other type.

fields.name: schedule_relationship
fields.description:
Indicates the status of stop’s service on the trip. Valid options are:
 0 - Scheduled.
 1 - Skipped.
 2 - Missing data.
 3 - Unscheduled.
 4 - Canceled.
 5 - Duplicated.
 6 - Schedule modified. (Note: schedule_arrival_time and schedule_departure_time may differ from GTFS in this case.)

name: stop_visits.schema.json
description: Summarized boarding, alighting, arrival, departure, and other events (kneel engaged, ramp deployed, etc.) by trip and stop for each service date.
